website_summaries.verdict: If you've been waiting for a smart device that streams effortlessly via voice command, the Fire Cube is likely to impress. However, there is the possibility of a few bugs.
pros: Enables you to stream without lifting a finger thanks to the hands-free voice control that works with Alexa and can be controlled from across a room
Comes with an Alexa Smart Remote
Can control other smart devices in your home
Offers 4K resolution for vivid colors and bold images
cons: Apps occasionally crash for unknown reasons
Alexa can awaken when watching and pause content

customer_reviews.title: Features to control anything outside of the "Smart TV" apps is lacking
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this and hook it up. I was immediately disappointed at the available functions for controlling cable (DirecTV in my case). Can't display guide, can't go to saved DVR programs. It can change the channel, that's it. I returned this within 24 hours of hooking it up.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne J. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Completely regret buying.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the features are cute and theoretically would be great but they dont work. And for Amazon will screw you one way or another. They gave this premium box a low grade remote. Was not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin E

customer_reviews.title: Just Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love the new remote, finally fire tv has a volume control, unit loads apps fast and downloading and installing is way faster than fire sticks by far, awesome streaming device, kodi works great, hard wired internet works great as well as Wi-Fi, I prefer the faster internet cable. not sure why other people in the reviews are have problems. Alex works great with my AV recover, just say Alexa tv on and reciver and tv turn on without issue. Best Fire TV box so far
customer_reviews.author: v.hen

customer_reviews.title: I haven’t been out of my bed in weeks with the Fire TV Cube. 5+ stars!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fire TV Cube! Does everything I expected plus more. I have nothing bad to say about it. I guess you could say it can make you lazy lol. Just ask her to turn on/off the TV, surround sound, lights, stereo, heater, fan, change channels and she does it immediately. Wonderful quality video and sound. I just wish it could learn someone’s name and not respond to anyone else. Still love it. Now I can be the hermit I’ve always wanted to be!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT interpret voice commands accurately at ALL
customer_reviews.text: Sucks, plain and simple. We’ve tried this for about 2+ months. Sometimes works, but usually the evening devolves into us screaming at it to do the simplest things. “Play Civilizations on Netflix.” “Hmmm. I’m not sure.” “Pause.” Get a snack. Come back. “Play”...”Play”...[gets audio, no video, stuck perpetually at 71%] And on and on. We’re getting an old laptop out to replace it. Screw your tech, Amazon. Worthless. We’re also just about to toss our Alexas out the window, as well. All units confused, all misplaying stations, all saying “Check the Alexa app...”. Really. So. Not. Helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Max M. Houck

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy it so far
customer_reviews.text: Besides recommending that you make sure that you CHECK to see if your tv is compatible - I say go for it. It didn't want to work right with my bedroom tv, so I moved it into my kid's room and took their box. It works fine with theirs, but some of the functions don't work. It's not the box; it's that I didn't check to see if it was compatible with ours and those features are not available for their tv model. It's not a huge thing, but it would have been nice. I hope this does as well as the first two models of the original fire tv box did. Those worked great, and we still use them.
customer_reviews.author: rockergirl15

customer_reviews.title: If you use a VPN Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: If you use a VPN the cube goes through spasms and essentially doesn't know what to do. Be prepared to reboot and hope you don't have to re login to all your other accounts like Netflix. It's about 50 50 that you will lose log ins. The cube has also been sent back once for warranty due to a software upgrade that bricked the cube. Two week turn around for that since they refuse to see a replacement. Has to be the worse Fire device ever made
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Would not connect to Internet
customer_reviews.text: Tried installing the new Amazon Fire Cube last night. It achieved a WIFI connection but Internet kept dropping out. This device might work for customers with a hard-wired Ethernet connection at their TV location, but not for others. Sticking with my trusty Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Lacking optical audio output
customer_reviews.text: Amazon blew it on this one. Her Amazon you forgot to include an optical audio output for us home theater buffs. I love watching my streaming services with audio playing through my $1000.00 home theater receiver. Not having an audio output of any kind killed that. Back to the drawing board boys!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I can pretty much throw my remote away!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this thing! And they’re always adding functionality! I come home from work and tell her to turn the tv on and put on ESPN! She can also turn it up and down! Looking forward to adding more equipment Alexa can control! My tv isn’t compatible with using certain commands as I bought it my freshman year of college 10 years ago! I think it’s time for a 4K tv!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Alexa has a mind of her own
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 @ $120 each. Now they're half that price. Commands are not working too well and one of the cubes turned on our projector system, by itself, in a house 4 hours away from where we are. The bulb life of the projector was decreased over 2 weeks of 24 hr/day because of this. Not too happy with FireTV Cube right now and feel I overpaid as well as maybe not a very well vetted product.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie T. Ocean Shores, WA

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience using Alexa. I am not that impressed, with the box or Alexa features but the 4K picture is better. I much would have rather purchased the 4K firestick and saved money. I figure myself constantly using the remote anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Banse Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Too slow and outdated
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this device. It's specs are outdated. Performance is slow. There is a bit of delay maneuvering through most menus. I have Roku stick that runs smoother and faster than the Cube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this firetvcube, its very hard for me to believe that it was designed to EXCLUDE home theater receiver, was told MANY times this was ONLY to be conneted to TV, and it works fine with that, I bought this device to connect to my Denon AVR S710W and then to my Samsung UN46C8000 I get picture but NO audio. VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Scam
customer_reviews.text: Only searches Amazon for movies, funneling you to paid content.
customer_reviews.author: RadiologyKen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture!
customer_reviews.text: Great so far... easy setup once I got my Visio sound bars figured out and Alexa paired perfectly. It’s pretty cool to tell Alexa to turn on tv, go to Pandora (but don’t say pandora Radio, it confuses her), etc. The best part is the picture... our older 55” Bravia has always had a great picture, but now it’s unbelievable. The hubby says well worth for that reason alone, the rest is good.
customer_reviews.author: Llinda

customer_reviews.title: No multi-room music on the cube.  Dealbreaker!
customer_reviews.text: The cube integration has been fantastic in my home and the device works flawlessly, I love it. Except for the fact that it does not support multi-room music like EVERY OTHER ALEXA device does. This is a product designed for your home theater and therefore should be the focal point on your multi room music yet it cant even do what a cheap Echo dot can? This IS NOT a true Alexa device. Save yourself some time and money and order a 4k fire stick and an echo dot, they will do what the amazon cube cant. Absolute fail Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sean O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Poor remote design
customer_reviews.text: The first generation remotes were great. The last few the remote design is bordering on defective. The first generation had a convenient latch on the back that you can open with your thumb. The current version you have to get a butter knife and pry it open. Not to mention the remote now has a slick back which makes it harder to hold than previous versions. The overall product is still really good and I continue to buy the new generation products but please redesign the remote. Go back to the first generation style which was vastly superior.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Careful what its connected to.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I connected it, my Samsung Smart television would randomly just shut off every ten to fifteen minutes. We've disconnected it and plan to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dorazio

customer_reviews.title: Good luck configuring Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: Unit will not configure Ethernet. ROKU rules - select hardwired and BAM it configures the Ethernet port. With fire? NADA
customer_reviews.author: Bernd J. Klawunder

customer_reviews.title: Not friendly, at least when using with DirectvNOW
customer_reviews.text: Freezes up periodically requiring power cycle. Does not well with DirectvNOW, not able to tune to stations. Fast forward through recordings does not provide visibility to where you are in the show. When you request a search if it does not find anything it takes you to a screen which you are not able to perform back function leaving you to open App again and navigating to where you were prior to search request. This may be a DirectvNOW thing, going to try with Roku stick and will report back
customer_reviews.author: Picasso

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea but it needs work
customer_reviews.text: Very slow to respond to commands (much slower than my echo dot) it Will open up the right streaming service app but fails to start streaming so I still need a remote. I do not like having to tell it 5 times to pause my show before it does. If ask it anything while the tv is on, Alexa puts the tv on mute for a few seconds but it does not pause what you are watching. It also cannot access any TV functions besides volume. You cant change inputs or settings.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Voice control is pretty sweet...which it didn’t pause tv when talking to Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Only used for for about a week... but so far it is works as expected. It controls my Samsung Tv and Samsung soundbar with voice control. One think I don’t like it is that it pauses any show or movie when you ask to turn up/down volume.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Forker

customer_reviews.title: No Youtube TV
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Fire Cube not realizing that there wasn't a Youtube TV application. I assumed that given the popularity of it there would be an app. Now I have wasted time an money on a device that doesn't meet my needs. Very disappointed Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Controls power, but can't do stuff the TV Stick can do
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my fire TV stick. I loved the stick, but wanted to be able to access the hands free Alexa controls. Much to my surprise, I found so many features in the OS curtailed from the last hardware version. Why? This is 4x more expensive! Most importantly, I can't mirror my phone. I never wanted to side load apps because that would likely slow things down. But I can't mirror my phone to be able to play things through my TV. Infuriating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOLBY ATMOS?
customer_reviews.text: Edit: After realizing the lack of Dolby Atmos content and the fact Netflix doesn't support Dolby Atmos on this device that this wasn't my only problem. I had a HDMI wire going in the wrong direction so i wasn't receiving Atmos sound until i swapped the wire in the other direction. Love this device! Claims to support dolby atmos but it doesn't work for me. I have it directly plugged into a sound bar that supports atmos that works for my 4k UHD player but not the TV cube.
customer_reviews.author: marky

customer_reviews.title: A long way from living up to what Amazon says the product can do.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t sync my Direct TV cable box to Fire TV cube. That severely limits Amazon’s advertising of the second generation. The picture is nice. I feel stupid buying the second generation Fire HD after buying the failed 1st generation. I’ve been through this before with Amazon and I expect either no response or a contact from someone who knows nothing. Thank God for Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Keville

customer_reviews.title: Fire TV Cube = voice + remote : not truly hands free
customer_reviews.text: Sadly the promise of being able to control all of your FireTV functions with your voice is not yet realized. You can really only turn the TV and issue search commands for content. All the other actions : Fill out forms, navigate, activate, move, select, interact with multi on the screen doesn’t work. So you get to use your voice to do a few things, and you still need to use the remote.
customer_reviews.author: M. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Directv Now streaming
customer_reviews.text: The Cube is not fully compatible with Directv Now streaming. The Cube will perform the tasks of turning on/off my LG Smart TV as well as adjusting volume up/down to my voice commands but it is unable to change to or find other stations. I contacted Directv Now and their representative advised me that they are working on the problem and “hope” to have it resolved in their next update which they “hope” to have out the first part of December. Once the update has been issued and I have had a chance to test it out, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H

customer_reviews.title: Plays a Fox TV commercial now for "24 Legacy"
customer_reviews.text: 1st time the day before I asked Alexa a math question "What is "350/24", then all the sudden a Fox TV commercial for "24 Legacy" keep playing anytime I asked Alexa the question. Today the commercial started repeating itself again when I asked Alexa another math question with 24 in it.. Telling me to do 25 push ups in a military voice. Afterwards the voice tells me to tune in on Mondays to watch "24 Legacy" on Fox. Cannot get it to stop. I will stop using Alexa immediately if Amazon is going to push commercials. Now, I feel bad, I ordered 3 2nd Gen. Echos for my brothers family for Xmas.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Lammy

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these Cube’s several months ago. I have a dozen or more smart assignments from the Amazon family. My wife constantly complained so often that they didn’t respond to female voices I was forced to remove it from the living room tv. Beyond my wife’s complaints I found they never worked with my Yamaha sound bar. I reinstalled the components dozens of times but have given up trying. Seems the sound bar was always on the wrong source and I had to use the remote anyways. The issues are endless and I’m exhausted trying to defend this box to my family. Done!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Flandreau

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't "controll" the TV,
customer_reviews.text: Although the Cube can turn the TV on and off you cannot get a view of the Cable Guide to choose a channel so the cube does not do away with the TV remote. Also the unit must be shouted at to get it's attention to do anything. Unit needs to be connected by blue tooth so It could be closer to the viewer.
customer_reviews.author: moe

customer_reviews.title: Only does a little of what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: It turns on the TV as I wanted but changes the TV off cable and on the wrong Hdmi everytime. It will change channels but wont turn on the cable, wont change to the DVR and there for wont access the DVR in any way. It also wont do my normal Alexa stuff like my Echo Show would without turning on my TV just to get my daily update. It's a downgrade from my Echo Show. All in all I'm dissatisfied with it. It said would access my cable box, but only to change channels and volume, but I watch my DVR most of the time, so if it wont do that I still need all my remotes!
customer_reviews.author: John Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it...just get the fire stick
customer_reviews.text: It is over sensitive and picks up voice commands while watching tv or movies...so constantly interrupting. I've had the cube for well over a year and would gladly appreciate Amazon accepting a trade-in on this product....but hmmm this happens to be one that they don't want back :/ I've started to recently experience streaming issues through the device. I switched to other forms of streaming with the same direct ethernet connection and have 0 issues. If you want to waste your money please let me know and I'll send you my mailing address to send your money.
customer_reviews.author: Lim1tless

customer_reviews.title: I am fairly happy with mine
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 fire TV sticks and 1 TV Cube and have been impressed with the TV Cube. Did I have some issues with the TV cube? Yes, definitely, but have been able to manage. It really makes the remote almost obsolete. I am happy it was able to configure with turning on my TV and Marantz receiver. Processes well and also controls my Hulu Plus/Live TV (I have cut the cord). I just ordered a second one. The new remote is also good, great to finally have power/volume/mute controls. Yes, it isn't perfect, I have to do a full reset maybe 2-3 times a week but its on the right track.
customer_reviews.author: C. Palacios

customer_reviews.title: No better than an echo and a stick
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old tv doesn’t allow to change inputs, won’t connect with my Xbox, says it isn’t connected to the internet but in settings says it is a lot. Could have gotten more out of an echo and fire stick.
customer_reviews.author: randy moore

customer_reviews.title: Downgrade from 4K Fire Stick
customer_reviews.text: Tries to do a lot of things beyond the traditional Fire Stic but none particularly well. Deal breaker for me is dialog is not synced properly, leading to lip sync issues in all streaming shows. This is with the Cube directly into my TV. I’ve also been unsuccessful in getting Dolby Atmos to work while I’ve had no issues with an Apple TV.
customer_reviews.author: BBK

customer_reviews.title: So far I love it
customer_reviews.text: After figuring out how to enable the skills for the apps on my firetv, this is working perfectly. Works great with Hulu Live. Displays my arlo cameras on my tv, turns on and off my LG tv and soundbar (it said it wasnt compatible, but it is!). Plus I have volume control and power on/off on my remote compared to firestick remote which doesnt have those features. So far this device is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Its is not an echo and a fire tv combined
customer_reviews.text: Amazon totally screwed up. They did not put every function of the echo on this device. So unless you do not have a smart tv do not buy this. Just get the regular fire tv and an echo and you can control your tv by voice. Only buy this if you have a dumb tv because the cube has infrared control. Otherwise its a complete waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Im happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Can it be better yes. Does everything I expected it to do. I like it much more than the Roku Ultra. I have no speed issues like in other reviews. I use it with PlayStation Vue and it works great. Also use it to control my vera home hub it does a great job. If i thought it was slow or I had speed or sluggish issues it would definitely get returned. Maybe some peoples networks aren't up to par?
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: That it doesn't work most of the time !
customer_reviews.text: Thie only thing it works consistently with is tv off and tv on. if you ask Alexa anything while tv id on it changes channels back to when tv is first turned on. change channels by voice commands is almost Impossible. If I ask it to go to channel 1008 it might end up going anywhere. I only what channels from 1000 - 1691. so if it does try to change stations it almost always goes to stations from 2- 999 instead of the station I ask for in the 1000- 1691. Like I ask for 1010 if it changes at all it will go to channel 10 but again it usually will not change at all. Terrible Product !
customer_reviews.author: LaDern Lane

customer_reviews.title: An exercise in frustration...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Fire TV Cube on Woot.com (an Amazon company) and have it hooked up to a 65in Samsung 4k tv. When it works (worked), it was great. Alexa voice recognition was good, and the picture was great. But more often than not, the screen will just blink off and on until I unplug the Cube and plug it back in again (doing a reset in the settings will not work). At first, it was only happening sporadically, which was bad enough. But now it happens all the time, to the point that it has become unusable. I have tried using different HDMI ports and cables, but the results are the same. Extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Louis H. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Now it's good
customer_reviews.text: Once I hooked up the Ethernet adaptor that came with the Cube it worked great. For some reason the Cube doesn't like Sling Tv, and it kept disconnecting. Now it works flawlessly. I love this thing. I love asking Alexa things, and I love all the things she can do. Turn the tv on, set timers, give weather, etc. Now if only she could tell better jokes. Overall I love this thing so much. Maybe I will change to 5 starts when I get to know it better. Always room for improvement. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Terrific!!
customer_reviews.text: The Cube is nothing less than terrific! It functions extremely well and definitely helps to greatly simplify "search issues" to find the specific movie or movie genre desired. There was a bit of a comedy act, initially, with me trying to "communicate with The Cube" properly (reminiscent of the original Star Trek characters trying to communicate with the ship's computer); however, Amazon Fire TV provides lots of hints and guidance on how to do exactly that. The remote device works very well, in the event that you prefer to not "talk to The Cube". You will love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Seeker707

customer_reviews.title: I cannot open this horrible remote back!
customer_reviews.text: First opened box and found I cannot open the back of remote to put in batteries. I listened to you tube videos and STILL cannot pry it open, rather frustrating right off the bat. Next i hear you need an HDMI cord seriously why isn't the full connection ability in the box? Without even plugging it in I am so discouraged already I have put it back in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time.....
customer_reviews.text: Took two hours with the help of cust support to set up with my system.....TV, Receiver, Direct TV and cube. Not intuitive at all. List of commands is very limited ( ie can't access dvr recordings, can't fast forward, etc. Occasionally turns on without prompting. We love our Echo, but the cube is simply not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tobin

customer_reviews.title: Sounds syncing issues. Terrible product so far.
customer_reviews.text: I am very annoyed with this purchase so far. I have a slight audio synch issue with the sound going from my fire TV cube to my Marantz receiver back up to my TV. After doing some research today I find that there are a lot of people having the same issue with The fire TV cube with no solution in sight. The best I have read is that one needs to connect the fire TV cube directly to the TV which does not help me at all. I will keep messing around with this thing for a few more weeks before returning it but so far I wouldn’t recommend it until they fix the syncing problem.
customer_reviews.author: moe123

customer_reviews.title: Fire TV Cube
customer_reviews.text: I love this cube! Works with Netflix, Amazon Prime, Plex, Cable, Direct TV, my sound bar, just about any device. I can ask Alexa to switch from Cable or DTV to Netflix and even request a particular show and she changes the TV. Love the voice interaction, can even tell her to turn the TV up or down. I've asked her to turn on the TV on Netflix and a show and she does! I highly recommend this little cube....and it's very small, not much bigger than a rubix cube.
customer_reviews.author: jholden63

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.  Prime Video always out of sync.
customer_reviews.text: I have a previous generation fire TV. The sound works fine on prime video content. I replaced it with this one and the sound on any prime video I play is out of sync. The funny thing is third party apps sound is in sync...
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: not ready for prime time...
customer_reviews.text: bought the cube to replace an older firetv, but i think we'll switch back to the old one. the biggest issue with the cube is lag time - holy cow - if you're used to quick response to your "alexa" commands, forget it. the cube takes 3-4 times as long, to complete any command (lights, scenes, etc.), as the much cheaper dot. and it's hit or miss on tv commands (i'd guess it gets about 40% of tv commands right). looked for a software update, but looks like i'm current... can't imagine why anyone would keep one of these, considering the drop in performance (off a cliff) compared to much less expensive options. stay far away.
customer_reviews.author: BlueChef1

customer_reviews.title: I’m Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with the Fire TV Cube so far. Installation, software update and setup took 10-15 minutes and I was watching my favorite streaming channels. (some required logging into again and a keyboard would be nice for this) I later went back and fine tuned all the settings and the picture is incredible! Still having trouble fine tuning the audio but I’m sure it will work itself out in a while. *Negatives - No digital audio interface, no app for Fandor. (Amazon, if you’re listening, please work with them to get their app on the fire devices. I’ve subscribed with them for a year.) As usual, I’ll update this review as needed. I highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Chiabatta

customer_reviews.title: Par Excellence for yet another Amazon Alexa Device! a Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my amazon fire tv cube on HSN,and it really adds full depth to the Alexa experience. Most will ask me,"but what can it do?" and I reply "you mean what can't it do?" it's a fully loaded experience for Prime users,to those who love music and beyond. One footnote,If you do have another Alexa device in the same room.. I'd suggest changing the wake word. My personal Amazon Echo dot,kept the name Alexa,but I used Echo for the Fire TV Cube's wake word!! Its worth every dollar I paid and well worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Drake

customer_reviews.title: The Difference Is Unbelievable!
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say I had a Roku for streaming “Sling” TV. The quality of the picture was always not that good. I also would periodically loose signal. I bought the Cube and it’s like the difference between NASA and the caveman axe. The picture is even better than I had with cable! I can’t say enough about how pleased I am with this device! Thank You Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Sprinky183

customer_reviews.title: New remote make it,  plus many custom set up choices.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this when it originally was released back in June. However with the new remote, it’s a whole new ball game. I switch the microphones off because it’s just annoying when it mistakenly hears orders from the TV in the midst of watching something. We have other Echo devices around the house that can can pick up on voice commands, that are away from surround speakers. So on that basis everything works great. I only need one remote to control my surround sound, TV and Fire TV, reducing clutter dramatically. My set up may not be totally how developers expect it to be used, but it works perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating and buggy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so bad for this to work especially with the new OTA DVR device but it is so buggy that it’s not useable in its current state. I have an Apple TV (non 4K) a roku ultimate and this. The apple I don’t like due to limited apps that allow you to buy/rent anything outside of iTunes and while I liked Roku I was hoping for more since we have an Amazon ecosystem in our house. The cube repeatedly froze and amazon can’t get out of their own way with their content front and center to focus on delivering good software and a GUI first. For now I’ve unplugged both the apple and firetv and will be usingthe Roku
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: It's great except for Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I had the original fire tv since it came out, but decided to upgrade. Alexa seems glichy the first day she was great. Now if I ask her to open Hulu she says no, if I tell her to go to the home screen she turns off the tv. One night I asked her to turn the volume up one notch and she turned it on all the way and everytime I turned it down manually she just kept turning it up. I gave 3 stars because now that I've given up on Alexa the device is great high quality play just like on the original fire tv.
customer_reviews.author: Sam'smom

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for an update....
customer_reviews.text: Alexa is not interacting well with the hulu app. Freezes once in a while and a white line appears after across screen. Thinking about returning. Did not hook up with the wifi lightbulbs. Ordering different brand of bulbs. If those dont work, returning everything to get an Apple TV 4k.
customer_reviews.author: William O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Careful of wording
customer_reviews.text: I do have what some say a lazy tongue so I found that using the voice remote I get my commends granted a lot better than yelling from yards away. I had to look up how to get Alexa to turn on and off my Xbox one S, I also have to learn the dialog to make sure Alexa do the right commends. So Amazon for the future Cube Tv, have the remote control more of the cable box without asking Alexa to do it, I do hope more and better app skills can be apply to Alexa so it can do more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Does not allow viewing of YouTube TV!
customer_reviews.text: I am very frustrated with my Fire Cube because the box indicated that I would be able to access YouTube TV but I can’t. I don’t think your customers should suffer because you can’t work out a deal with YouTube (or whomever). I wish I would have just bought another Apple TV.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Carey

customer_reviews.title: What the heck?  Not compatible with YouTube TV.
customer_reviews.text: This device allows you to look at YouTube, but not YouTube TV! How can this be?! We are cutting the cable cord and this device will not let us see the best provider of live content. I went with the Cube instead of Roku, which was a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: MJE

customer_reviews.title: Huge flaw in the lack of gigabit ethernet
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed it and didn't include a gigabit ethernet port should be fired. I know that it has wireless that in theory can come close to it, but all that's in theory. Wirelessly, it has trouble streaming my biggest Blueray and 4K files. Even with the ethernet (100baseT) dongle, it still has that problem. Honestly, it would've cost just a few more bucks to add a gigabit ethernet port. So now I have a Raspberry Pi4 attached to the TV just to play those big files.
customer_reviews.author: Chae

customer_reviews.title: Needs a lot of work!  Go back to drawing board on this one.
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple alexa devices and in most cases own many of the same devices that I've now put in different parts of my house. I would rate all of the at 5 stars. However, this cube struggles big time. Has a lot of trouble hearing you and is slow to respond. Often it does what you don't ask and is limited on other functions that other devices can do. It is also not great at all to control TVs and media. I went back to just using the remote. Wish I could still return the two I brought.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Buy Now, it is worth it for the remote alone!!
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed by this device. I already had a 4K fire stick and regular fire stick so wasn’t sure it would really be as impressed as I was. Setting up other tv components was easy and worked again better than I anticipated. I love the full Alexa experience and went from 2 devices to one in the living Room now. I’d honestly buy this for the Remote alone! LOVE the volume and power button and want this for my other TVs! Also getting all devices to use the sound bar now even seems easier because of the cube setup. So if you can’t tell, buy it now while it’s half off any you’ll be as happy as I’ve been.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Magical Gadget
customer_reviews.text: I received one of these as a gift and i had zero expectations going in. I am BLOWN AWAY. The Fire TV cube really makes your home feel that much more futuristic. Example: "Alexa Turn on the TV" - Turns on TV and SoundBar "Alexa Tune to Nick JR" - Switches to Cable Input, and changes channel to Nick JR "Alexa Play the Office on NetFlix" - Switches to Correct input, Opens Netflix, plays the office from the last episode i was watching "Alexa Switch to HDMI2" - Switches signal Its crazy! Anyways, in summary, i am impressed. Its awesome and everyone should get one.
customer_reviews.author: Mukaking

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mom, but I may love it more! I am a serial Amazon product purchaser. I buy everything when it comes out. This was no different. My mom stopped paying for cable because she was sick of how much it costs vs how much she was using it. I knew she felt bummed that she didnt have access to anything to watch anymore outside of her laptop. This was a great solution. She has so many options all through the Fire TV. A robust amount of services/apps and works with Alexa! If I didnt have a fire stick in every bedroom, then I would buy this for myself as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this device. I have several fire sticks and a few echo dots. My DirecTV Now app is significantly slower then my 4k firestick the cube replaced. There is a noticeable delay in any action using the remote. This did not happen on the firestick. The firestick is farther away and on wireless and is still faster then the rj45 connected cube. Also the abity to control my av receiver is nice however the different volume levels between apps is hard to take. If we ask Alexa anything the volume is easily twice what we have for our TV. Way too loud.
customer_reviews.author: MrScheib

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for an Alexa fan
customer_reviews.text: I was and early adopter to the Alexa ecosystem and TV. I have about 8 or 9 devices now, including the Echo, a couple dots, fire sticks, kindles and this Fire TV Box. This box is easily the most disappointing since the original 4K Stick which never set up correctly on my wifi and I returned immediately. This Fire TV works well when it wants, but only when it wants to work. It has been sluggish and buggy. It doesn't respond well to voice or remote commands. I have had to reboot it repeatedly. Unfortunately, I am outside of return time so I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Krusty

customer_reviews.title: My TV/Receiver are now voice activated
customer_reviews.text: Love how it is able to control both TV/Receiver. One button to turn off Alexa constantly listening. Tip for programming older receiver/TV - Fire TV Cube will try to "guess" the IR code. If it can't, it will ask to learn by capturing the signal from your remotes. When "teaching" Fire TV Cube with your other remotes, point them to the actual Fire TV Cube box, not to the IR repeater. The Fire TV Cube itself has IR. So it can sit right next to your TV and control TV, while IR repeater can sit in your cabinet and control other components.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from Fire TV box
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take the place of the original Fire TV box, of late it had begun having issues with buffering....which I know wasn't an internet issue because we have the fastest internet in the nation. The Cube has worked flawlessly since being installed, the addition of Alexa , at least too me is the reason for the -1 star, I don't much care for it, and when my wife does use it, it freezes the on screen picture.
customer_reviews.author: D. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great Product All Around
customer_reviews.text: What is there not to like about the fire cube. It is super fast, controls the whole tv, has Alexa in the remote and the cube itself, streams all my shows on Amazon, Netflix, and Hulu, and is built well. It can do anything the echo dot or echo can do and then some. I highly recommend this product. The only issue is that the Alexa hearing isn't that good and gets what I ask wrong quite often but this is on all amazon products w/ Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Orr

customer_reviews.title: Ripped off
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that the price dropped $60 after ordering it. The interface is a bit klunky as well. It defaults to the fire homepage instead of the previous input. This is super annoying if you watch much cable.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Hennig

customer_reviews.title: Spectrm App Isn't Available - This is a no go
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Fire Cube yesterday. I unboxed, set up - which was a huge pain since my device kept telling me my password was incorrect requiring me to contact support. I installed updates, and immediately searched for the Spectrum app. When I found out it isn't available on Fire Cube, I re-boxed the $119 paper weight and set it up for return. I'll stick with Apple TV. Thanks for wasting my time. It's pretty sad that a nearly $1T company can't get something this simple correct.
customer_reviews.author: Chrispy from KC

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Glitchy at best. After several hours goes into hybernate. Will not wake up with voice. Playing a movie, step outside for 10 minutes, reverts to home screen. Have to then search again for the movie. Basically false advertising. “Alexa” please work like the advertisementl “Ikm sorry, I dont recognize that request” I have turned off the voice toy and use the remote. That works ok...just ok. This tech is not really ready for market yet.do
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for TV control
customer_reviews.text: I like the FireTV products. This one being able to turn on/off my TV/soundbar, change inputs, & adjust volume is awesome. The sound is a bit tinny from the speaker itself, but most responses come through my sound bar. It mutes the TV input for listening & responses, which isn't an issue, except it occasionally misses unmuting it. I'd prefer if it would play items without turning on the TV & soundbar, but it's not a big concern. Now that it's been updated to work with multi-room sound, it can easily be part of a home wide listening experience.
customer_reviews.author: Greg R.

customer_reviews.title: Great potential, but crippling software
customer_reviews.text: Likes: It's awesome having one remote to turn on TV, change volume, and control the cube. Voice commands work well for me. Dislikes: Lots and lots of ads. The UI was definitely designed with Amazon's interests first and the user's interests second. When I press home, I want to have it focus on my apps, not the ads. No support for mirroring my devices (eg miracast). No YouTube app. Limited apps compared to Google play. These could all be fixed via software which would make this a killer device.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: First impress is not good
customer_reviews.text: Received it, it was lay next to my mailbox, Tried to run through set up stupid device would not send verification code to my phone. I call tech support and they try to send my to my wireless carrier for for support. The verification window does not even have resend verification on it. I told them i can get 2 step verification mode on my email. Support was not help at all. I had to disable 2 step verification to get it register to work.
customer_reviews.author: Dj

customer_reviews.title: not a helping hand i thought
customer_reviews.text: this is not the tech wonder its made out to be .. has trouble changing imputs on TV when requested , seem like most functions are difficult access with voice command no blue tooth for the lights on menu , and doesn't scan for my smart plugs . went thur the troubles shooting process tutorials was of no value to my concerns or issues. just as easy make requested changes manually perhaps i need to upgrade to larger box to achieve required purposes i saw advertised being a bit handicapped i thought this would make my life easier but it hasn't lived up to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Wm Ratcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is easier to pick out the few things I did not like than to list all of the things I love about it. 1) it doesn't always know what I am talking about so results can be interesting. 2)No support for Spectrum TV streaming service. The second is not really Amazon's fault. Seems odd that they have support for fire tablets and phones but not TV products. Other than that, nearly perfect! Love having access to my smart home devices and hands free control of my electronics including my 8 yr old Panasonic TV and my new Yamaha sound bar. Have not really tried Blu Ray player with it yet but that will require some manual processes anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. and Rebecca E. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Wish we could return.
customer_reviews.text: Wish we could return this item. It’s only real difference is that it can turn your tv and volume off and on. You cannot connect the box to any of the multiple speaker groups to play music with all echos. It doesn’t have the same functions that regular echos do. Save your money and just buy the echo dot.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Belew

customer_reviews.title: Dumpster Fire TV
customer_reviews.text: Commands: This thing barely understands anything you say. Launching Prime Video and asking to open a series always opens episode one. Despite the fact you’ve watched half of the episodes. Seriously. You had one job. Remote: Even Apple realized you need a volume control on a remote. Asking Alexa to change the volume takes about 10 seconds to happen. By then I’m already deaf. Ads: The product you just paid over $100 for has ads that you can’t get rid of. I don’t want to expose my family to this. That’s why I dropped cable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Furious

customer_reviews.title: It surpasses Apple 4K bo
customer_reviews.text: I am an old hard school apple guy...since the 80s. If Apple made it, I bought it. And I loved it. To be honest, since the passing of Steve Jobs, It's not the same beast. They have missed the boat and relying on old technology. And they don't get why he was such an ass....except he wanted it right. This Amazon cube, remote is flawless, no streaming problems, interface fab...and most of all for us Cut the Cord users, it works! And it works well.
customer_reviews.author: pnumbno

customer_reviews.title: Update to review
customer_reviews.text: The Sling promotion (3 months free) was the selling point for me. I really didn't need the Cube. I registered the promo code on the Sling site, but the Sling app keeps asking for a credit card and will not let me view anything until I pay for service. The Cube itself is OK. Update: An Amazon assistant called to explain how to apply the Sling promotion. This kind of service is impressive. Aside from the Sling promotion glitch, a lack of knowledge on my part, I am pleased with Cube. It is not as easy to used as I had anticipated, resulting in the loss of one star, but overall, a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cube-No No
customer_reviews.text: The Cube has been nothing but a headache. 1. Loses contact with Sound Bar 2. Loses contact with network 3. Cannot view Apple TV +, all other fire sticks can view Apple TV 4. This item may someday be viable but not this current designed device 5. I am outside my return date so I plan to scrape device and replace with a Fire Stick 4K, costly choice of my part
customer_reviews.author: Phil S.

customer_reviews.title: Needs a stronger CPU
customer_reviews.text: Features are dynamite! I was impressed with the function. It is just plain SLOW... I loaded Kodi to handle my live TV and access my video libraries via my NAS. All this worked just fine with no problems. Refreshing a video library takes forever!! I had been using Intel I5 laptops and media machines (4) with Kodi for a few years. When they update my video libraries (800 movies, 4,600 TV episodes) they take about three minutes. The Cube takes over 20 minutes to do the same job. I love the cube.... I would gladly pay an additional hundred bucks for a cube that could replace my media machines. As it is, It's just a slow toy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Eddy Ivey

customer_reviews.title: Had very high expectations from this unit
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for the shipping box/packaging. Very impressive product packaging. Setup was a breeze as well. The bad reviews are from Alexa's ability to interact (voice recognition) and the periodic "freezing" of the cube. The unit itself displays a roving color - tried all troubleshooting customer service asked me to. The issue would only go away by a hard power reboot...for a few weeks! Continuing to experience the same issues... just ignoring the bad side.
customer_reviews.author: NokiaFan

customer_reviews.title: Great picture but not at all satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I had to get the Fire Cube because my Blu Ray player was no longer supported by Amazon Prime! The only systems available were with " Alexa", which I did not need or want! Then after installation, I couldn't use my Blu Ray as a sound system, without using the "Alexa" feature. Also, every time audio is heard in the area with words or names ( like: "I use tah", "Alexi", etc...), the Cube lights up with a blue light, like Kitt from Knight Rider! It would get 5 stars if I felt that I was the one that was getting all the capabilities from the device, for the services that I pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Ron and Marcia B. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Requires Internet and Not well integrated with Devices
customer_reviews.text: I finally cut the cord and outfitted my whole house with Fire TV and was reasonably happy until I lost internet and realized I cannot FireTV without. I have setup my system so I have an antenna (through Tablo) and DLNA (through Plex), but without internet, I cannot access these apps through Amazon FireTV to use them. Not sure why Amazon couldn't have setup the system with the front end accessible without the need for internet. Based on my understanding, Roku will allow you to access these apps, so I think after spending all my money to setup FireTV, I'm switching to Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for Prime time
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge kindle, echo, and fire fan. Three fire tv sticks. Multiple kindles and three fire 10 tablets (including one show dock) and 5 echos. Which is why I had high hopes for the fire tv cube. But after 6 months I am giving up. The fire tv stick's remote gives me almost all the same voice control with far superior control using the remote's hand controls. And as an Alexa device the cube is a poor second to an echo with its built in speakers. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Can’t tell you how disappointed I am in this latest and previous versions of Fire tv. Every time I upgrade to a newer version I’m hoping you would get it right, yet you continue to fail.. Why can’t you make a decent unit that picks up 5G ? Time to start looking elsewhere.. Found some blame is the Fios router, terrible range. Replaced it with Netgear R7000, has much better range, but the cube still has lousy reception, reading bad antennas. I have to run cat 7 cables to stream 4K movies. Still very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: James Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Sound cuts off
customer_reviews.text: On multiple occasions I find that I need to unplug the unit from the AC to regain sound that I redirected to the TV! Also I wish it could control my Samsung TV secondary menu to select Fire-TV as a default Input! I can issue a voice command to power-on my TV but each time I need to manually select Fire-TV as my input via remote control when my TV starts up.
customer_reviews.author: UNIX Guru

customer_reviews.title: I like it...
customer_reviews.text: I read the complaints, the positive reviews and the negative ones as well. I have to say that this is a pretty solid device. I really like, the convenience of being able to control my whole upstairs and downstairs unit really makes it top notch. I do not have any complaints at this point. I'm glad that Azmaon went with a device with a bit more ram and power, I can definitely feel it vs the previous generation devices. It is also a good touch that it has a IR extender device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vert disappointed and disenchanted.
customer_reviews.text: 1.No camera in the cube...that sucks. 2.Cannot make calls ...that blows.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Margado

customer_reviews.title: Not ready!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give this a higher rating. But it is crap at being an Alexa device in general, forget controlling things. I have many of the Alexa devices, some perform better than others, but this is a let down. It rarely understands anything regardless of where I put it. It fumbles simple tasks, and fails to perform others all together. I’ll be sending it back for a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Definitive X

customer_reviews.title: Geat for cable cutters
customer_reviews.text: I loved the 4k streaming, loved the voice control, loved the search engine, loved the look and appearance, loved the remote control. Was disappointed in the no drop in and the other features the dot enjoys. I would hope that some soft-ware upgrades are in the works, really want the same abilities as other echo devices. Overall very useful. Oh and the sound quality and control are much better than many smart tv apps.
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: Nice Streaming Device
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a good device but this week I started loosing the network connection regardless of wired or wifi and I have to constantly keep rebooting the device, too bad my wife threw away the box so could return it but I am thinking of switching to the roku box instead, nit very happy at all. Update: I was blaming the Fire TV Cube for the connection issues but I found out it was a setting that I found in my PIA vpn that was killing the connection, it's the kill vpn switch in PIA I disabled that and now my connection is always working fine. So I changed this from a 1 to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse6749

customer_reviews.title: Fire cube is better than the stick!
customer_reviews.text: Alexa turn on the tv! Well from my experience, I have both. The cube can connect to 5g and the 4k stick cant. Why does this matter? Since i got rid of cable I'm using hulu for live TV. When it is connected to the stick, it always freezes on live TV. The cube never has a problem. If your just using Netflix the stick is for you. But if you will use live TV with hulu, sling or vue. Recommend cube or a antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Darkness
customer_reviews.text: When it works and hears what you’re saying it’s great. When it doesn’t...well... This thing is clunky. The interface is pretty and easy to navigate but the controls. Ugh. She takes precious seconds when you tell her to pause or even hit the pause button on the remote. The TV screen will go black midway through a program so that the audio is still audible but here’s no visuals. I’ve had this thing since Black Friday and you’d think there’s a fix in the firmware by now for that but nope. Those are literally my only two issues. Fix that and it’ll be an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy
customer_reviews.text: Glitchy and hardly works. I have an echo that works great. This thing however hardly understands any commands. Junk
customer_reviews.author: wesley belanger

customer_reviews.title: A great gift, but not sure I would have bought it myself
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing concept, I love the integration between the fire cube and my echo dots and being able to control my TV without a remote is amazing. I have a toddler obsessed with remotes so hands free is a blessing. That being said it is very buggy. I will randomly have to say "Alexa, turn off tv" to turn it ON, it has trouble playing specifics at times, and randomly has issues. Accessing YouTube/YouTube TV is difficult, if not impossible at times. Netflix and Amazon Prime both work well fairly consistently. Overall, it's a great concept but if I get a device that costs over $100 I expect it to have less issues.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Love the cube
customer_reviews.text: The FireTV Cube does a great job at controlling our TV and soundbar (both LG). When I ask to play a song or album it finds it in my music library or Amazon unlimited. Want to watch a show just tell Alexa. Need it louder or softer, just say so. And when ready to shut down, just say: Alexa, turn off the TV. And she powers everything off. Now were not just down to one remote, most of the time I don't even use a remote.
customer_reviews.author: AFrisby

product_meta.title: Fire TV Cube (1st Gen), hands-free with Alexa and 4K Ultra HD and 2nd Gen Alexa Voice Remote - Previous Generation
feature_bullets: Fire TV Cube is the first hands-free streaming media player with Alexa. From across the room, just ask Alexa to turn on the TV, dim the lights, and play what you want to watch.

With far-field voice recognition, eight microphones, and beamforming technology, Fire TV Cube hears you from any direction. Enjoy hands-free voice control of content—search, play, pause, fast forward, and more. Plus control the power and volume on your TV, soundbar, and A/V receiver as well as change live cable or satellite channels with just your voice.

Fire TV Cube has a built-in speaker that lets you check the weather, make and receive calls with compatible devices, control compatible smart home devices, and more—even with the TV off. Fire TV Cube is always getting smarter with new Alexa skills and voice functionality.
Experience true-to-life picture quality with access to vivid 4K Ultra HD up to 60 fps and HDR. Enjoy the audio clarity of Dolby Atmos on select Prime Video titles.
Experience tens of thousands of channels, apps, and Alexa skills, plus millions of websites like Facebook and Reddit.
An Amazon Prime membership unlocks thousands of movies and TV episodes including "Thursday Night Football" and Amazon Originals like “The Big Sick” and “Sneaky Pete”.
Launch and control content with the Alexa Voice Remote. Watch favorites from Netflix, YouTube, Prime Video, HBO, STARZ, SHOWTIME, and more, plus stream for free with Tubi, IMDb TV, and others.
